settings.heading: For just the cost of a bottleof water, you can make a difference.
settings.desc: A small donation of just $1.00 or $2.00 may seem like a small sacrifice, but it truly does make a difference in our world.

settings.heading: Sierra Leone is, sadly, the poorest country in the world.
settings.desc: In 2007 Karen and I took a 2 week trip to Sierra Leone in support of our church’s missionary family living there. This experience changed our lives forever. Before leaving, I asked our missionary what he believed to be the greatest need in Sierra Leone. His answer came quickly...water. We decided to get involved with Africa Oasis Project.

settings.heading: Each well serves around 2,000 people.
settings.desc: That means it costs only about $3.50 to provide clean water for 20 years. A small donation of just $1 or $2, the cost of a single bottle of water, seems like such a small sacrifice but it truly makes a difference in our world.

settings.heading: MAKING A DIFFERENCE IN SIERRA LEONE

settings.content: <iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Yc4CBGcLgM4" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen=""></iframe>

settings.label: do not have access to clean water.

settings.heading: While in Africa, we shared the hope of Jesus Christ with a people for whom you would think there is little hope.
settings.content:
With the help of our small group of 9 people, we visited 34 schools, distributing Christian booklets called the Book of Hope to over 24,000 students and teachers. The Book of Hope is a scripture book designed to engage and speak to the needs of children and youth within various African cultures.

The children in these pictures are fortunate because their families have enough money to send them to school. There is no public education in Sierra Leone, you must pay to go to school. Some students actually sneak into the classrooms. In one school with an enrollment of 1200 pupils we distributed over 1300 booklets. The hope for Sierra Leone and West Africa is in these children.

settings.heading: Most children in Sierra Leone are not so fortunate. According to recent report by UNICEF, 78% of the children between the ages of 7 and 14 are engaged in child labor.

settings.content: The study, which covered one quarter of the world's population, ranked Sierra Leone last among nations surveyed. Our Christian faith teaches that it is not enough to tell people about Jesus without attempting to provide for their human needs (James 2:14-17).

settings.text: Read the latest newsletter from the missionaries on the ground in Africa.
